channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @AD_Lobel Useful when discussing staffing policies for public transport.
item.source:markdown: @AD_Lobel Useful when discussing staffing policies for public transport.

item.description: @EladNehorai Also, the precise opposite of the truth of the past century of American Jewish history. “Jewish pride” manifested in the 70s after the decline and canceling of antisemitism in the previous two decades.
item.source:markdown: @EladNehorai Also, the precise opposite of the truth of the past century of American Jewish history. “Jewish pride” manifested in the 70s after the decline and canceling of antisemitism in the previous two decades.

item.description: @AD_Lobel “I’m just like Anne Frank, like Indiana Jones” — @bobdylan, “I Contain Multitudes,” 2020
item.source:markdown: @AD_Lobel “I’m just like Anne Frank, like Indiana Jones” — @bobdylan, “I Contain Multitudes,” 2020

item.description: @EladNehorai Also, he was featured in a friendly 2018 JTA piece that I ran in the @JewishStandard at the time.

item.description: @joshtpm On the plus side, it’s pretty clear that Woodward’s next book now has the working title of The Guns of August.
item.source:markdown: @joshtpm On the plus side, it’s pretty clear that Woodward’s next book now has the working title of The Guns of August.

item.description: @HangleyJr @joshtpm Of course, that frame raises a question uncomfortable for Team R: Should the FBI not protect classified defense secrets for fear of Republican lawlessness?
item.source:markdown: @HangleyJr @joshtpm Of course, that frame raises a question uncomfortable for Team R: Should the FBI not protect classified defense secrets for fear of Republican lawlessness?

item.description:
@KobaltJew Nobody promised that life in the Internet Age was going to be fun

@KobaltJew Well, I guess Wired Magazine did. As a former subscriber, I apologize.
item.source:markdown:
@KobaltJew Nobody promised that life in the Internet Age was going to be *fun*
@KobaltJew Well, I guess Wired Magazine did. As a former subscriber, I apologize.

item.description:
@TomLevenson As I see it, the “best” case for him is that he just petulantly packed up rather than file everything that crossed his desk after he lost the election. So these could be boxes of McDonald’s receipts. And the occasional notes on a PDB.

@TomLevenson Just his habitual law breaking.

@TomLevenson Still a phenomenal hill for a party to die on.

@TomLevenson Worst case is actual sellable security secrets he had no need to access and evidence of crimes.

@TomLevenson I certainly would want to see the FBI receipt before jumping to his defense…
@nycsouthpaw @AkivaMCohen fyi
item.source:markdown: @nycsouthpaw @AkivaMCohen fyi

item.description: @nberlat The Times doesn’t have a public editor for the same reason I don’t have a personal stylist.
item.source:markdown: @nberlat The Times doesn’t have a public editor for the same reason I don’t have a personal stylist.

item.description: @DBashIdeas Now you have me wondering about the executive issues that led to the editorial problems Dr. Leiman pointed out….
item.source:markdown: @DBashIdeas Now you have me wondering about the executive issues that led to the editorial problems Dr. Leiman pointed out….

item.description: @DainyBernstein I might have a hard copy. Should I check?
item.source:markdown: @DainyBernstein I might have a hard copy. Should I check?

item.description:
@joshtpm This behavior points to big-time criming. But Trump’s Razor suggests that it’s all receipts for McDonalds takeout and similarly trivial records that he petulantly refused to file according to protocol (and law) after the election.

@joshtpm Probably some colorful PDBs for Dummies and the like, but mostly just trivia, held on to for the sake of gratuitous rule-breaking.

@joshtpm So no smoking gun memos which could possibly be forged and planted; just ten boxes of junk, with the equivalent of pizza recipes and gefilte fish tariff negotiations.
@joshtpm Yes. But see who he has been hanging out with. https://t.co/Bxat8YDyZw
item.source:markdown: @joshtpm Yes. But see who he has been hanging out with. https://t.co/Bxat8YDyZw

item.description: In which the author convinces me to buy a copy of his book. I suspect some of my fellow old school Mideast hands — @kampeas, @SilowCarroll, and likely even @joshtpm — will be similarly intrigued by this Roman a clef. https://t.co/GyC23SMS64
item.source:markdown: In which the author convinces me to buy a copy of his book. I suspect some of my fellow old school Mideast hands — @kampeas, @SilowCarroll, and likely even @joshtpm — will be similarly intrigued by this Roman a clef. https://t.co/GyC23SMS64

item.description: @ZachWeiner Sure, it sounds geeky. But then I remember hearing the word “fractal” in the Frozen lyrics when I saw it ij the theater with my kids.
item.source:markdown: @ZachWeiner Sure, it sounds geeky. But then I remember hearing the word “fractal” in the Frozen lyrics when I saw it ij the theater with my kids.

item.description: @AkivaMCohen My policy of not signing laws is starting to seem almost as wise as my policy of not committing federal felonies.
item.source:markdown: @AkivaMCohen My policy of not signing laws is starting to seem almost as wise as my policy of not committing federal felonies.

item.description: @cstross Where on the scale do you rank our former president, who asked his generals why they couldn’t be more like Hitler’s, only to be told by them that the German generals tried to assassinate their boss?
item.source:markdown: @cstross Where on the scale do you rank our former president, who asked his generals why they couldn’t be more like Hitler’s, only to be told by them that the German generals tried to assassinate their boss?

item.description: @bruces “In the 21st century, computers will generate so much wealth that we will be constantly declining offers of free cookies.”
item.source:markdown: @bruces “In the 21st century, computers will generate so much wealth that we will be constantly declining offers of free cookies.”

item.description: @MichaelDPress This was well after Agnon’s goat story, was it not?
item.source:markdown: @MichaelDPress This was well after Agnon’s goat story, was it not?

item.description:
@cstross My Orthodox Jewish group was sufficiently evangelical or even cultish that the Peoples Temple massacre was the subject of some very nervous jokes.

@cstross I recall a SNL sketch parodying the Dr Pepper commercials (“How would you like to be a Peppe?”) which similarly unnerved us.

@cstross Anyway, I share Heinlein’s faith that America will escape theocracy. Eventually. https://t.co/JTJ67bQopb
Add this to the “wickedly great” side of the ledger, as we used to say. https://t.co/RE0vFuK6mK
item.source:markdown: Add this to the “wickedly great” side of the ledger, as we used to say. https://t.co/RE0vFuK6mK

item.description:
@cstross You might also want to delete your law abiding Republican Christian friends.

@cstross I can’t imagine that these stories will help with Christian youth group recruitment.
item.source:markdown:
@cstross You might also want to delete your law abiding Republican Christian friends.
@cstross I can’t imagine that these stories will help with Christian youth group recruitment.

item.description:
It looks like ⁦@lavietidhar⁩’s Martian Sands is now available, along with nine presumably Golda-free other SF titles, for only $20. https://t.co/jdtvgHZJIC

My review of Martian Sands is here: https://t.co/56kccaEYmB

From the review: “One cannot and must not try to erase the past merely because it does not fit the present,” Golda Meir once said.

Clearly the fourth prime minister of Israel did not support time travel as part of Israel’s nonconventional arsenal – at least not publicly.

But would she really have disapproved of the opening scene of “Martian Sands,” in which an Israeli agent from the future offers President Franklin Delano Roosevelt advanced weaponry from the State of Israel to fight Hitler and liberate the Jews of Europe back in 1941?
item.source:markdown:
It looks like ⁦@lavietidhar⁩’s Martian Sands is now available, along with nine presumably Golda-free other SF titles, for only $20. https://t.co/jdtvgHZJIC
My review of Martian Sands is here: https://t.co/56kccaEYmB
From the review: “One cannot and must not try to erase the past merely because it does not fit the present,” Golda Meir once said.
Clearly the fourth prime minister of Israel did not support time travel as part of Israel’s nonconventional arsenal – at least not publicly.
But would she really have disapproved of the opening scene of “Martian Sands,” in which an Israeli agent from the future offers President Franklin Delano Roosevelt advanced weaponry from the State of Israel to fight Hitler and liberate the Jews of Europe back in 1941?
